net.hudup.core.evaluate

Interface MetricValue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayMetricValue, CosineTwoArrayMetricValue, FractionMetricValue, MeanMetricValue, MonoMetricValue, PearsonTwoArrayMetricValue, TwoArrayMetricValue

    public interface MetricValue
extends java.io.Serializable, Cloneable
    This interface represents value of a metric, called metric value. It can be anything but in current implementation, it only reflects real number (float number) via the method value().
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accum(MetricValue metricValue)
      Taking the accumulative operator.
      boolean isUsed()
      Testing whether or not this metric value is used.
      void reset()
      Resetting this metric value.
      float value()
      Getting real value of MetricValue.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.hudup.core.Cloneable

        clone

    • Method Detail

      • value

        float value()
        Getting real value of MetricValue. Such real value is often mean number (average number).
        Returns:
        real value of MetricValue.

      • isUsed

        boolean isUsed()
        Testing whether or not this metric value is used.
        Returns:
        whether or not this metric value is used.

      • accum

        void accum(MetricValue metricValue)
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Taking the accumulative operator. For example, the accumulative addition operator will add this MetricValue to the specified MetricValue and then, the result is set back to this MetricValue.
        Parameters:
        metricValue - specified MetricValue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any error raises.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resetting this metric value. For example, its real number returned by (value()) is re-set to be 0.
